intro: Lathyrus gorgoni subsp. tiriopolitanus, commonly known as the Tiriopolitan vetch, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its climbing habit and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically purple or blue in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
